channel.title: Moparcraft and Minecraft and where they need to go
channel.description:
Obviously resetting the map isn't a real solution to the problem and I think we can all agree on that. Enabling PvP certainly adds more factors to the game and more levels of difficulty. However it also enables some other not so wanted effects. And neither adding or disabling PvP is going to change griefing.
People seem to think making mobs harder wont be enough because of pr-existing structures and I don't really agree with that. Who's just going to log in and stay in the same structure for the rest of their virtual life. YOU HAVE to go out and collect resources, build more and explore. Its a fundamental part of the game.
However I'm sure if a plugin can be made to change mob health, damage and frequency. Then surely you could modify the spawning conditions under which mobs appear making them even more difficult. Instead of rallying everyone against each other through PvP based activities rally them against something that has no human face.
The problem at hand is the game it's self just isn't currently difficult enough for most veteran gamers and it is sort of still in its infancy. The only real thing we can do is wait for more updates and hope that it address's the problem at it's core.
As for stealing its my personal belief if you steal from someone its the same as griefing them. It adds up to the same exact thing as destroying their structure and adds potential emotional distress to lower age groups. It directly effects their buildings and the same goes for killing them. Another rule that doesn't necessarily need to be removed but [b]added[/b] is English only. This is a fairly major rule that isn't written anywhere on the rules list. Not only do I find the rule its self unfair. I also find not having the rule listed as unfair. It gives people who are foreign to English a possible expectation to being able to use their language freely. And a added effect of removing the rule is we could potentially gain more players.
Everyone's pushing towards a closer community and to be honest I don't believe all of us living together is going to change anything besides make us fight more. Were in a world that can constantly expand to 8 times the surface area of the earth. This could easily be classified as a Super-Earth and there's no reason we shouldn't spread out. In-fact breaking up into smaller groups could make the game even more exciting then oppose to everyone living together in utopia.
I didn't post this in any other topic as it really ties everything together.
Edit: Even if your new to the server or forums or don't even participate in the sever I would still very much like to see your opinion. So please don't be afraid to share it.

item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:22, topic:400234”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=497307.msg3637013#msg3637013 date=1308674218]

Yes but if we didn’t have all these new issues we added to the game ourselves, people wouldn’t have to live far away… I remember when everyone lived close together, it was pretty awesome.

But in the end, it just causes fighting and splitting up. At its peak, UE had 15(?) people, but that lasted for a day. When it comes to big cities like that, new players just come in, get a couple of resources, and move out with their friends.

they could also disable PvP in their area if they wish

How about when you log in for the first time, you have the option for pvp to be yes or no. Then, you can change it throughout the game, but only every 24 hours.

I’ll quote the official minecraft sites…

Multiplayer nurtures the community spirit; people work together to build things, and unite in the face of griefers. It is the strong policing of these rooms, powered by a “patriotic” attachment to the game, (or one’s favorite server) that makes the game very hard for griefers.

If we unite in the face of griefers, how come people can’t build wood houses? Griefers are a pain to stop, do you know how easy it is for 1 person to make 5 accounts and endlessly rush your house? This game isn’t hard for griefers, just the opposite. Flint and steel is to easy to make. I think Notch needs to add a minecraft ‘free trial’ kinda thing, where you can play freely anywhere for 14 days, and make cracked clients completely unusable, even with ‘offline mode’ turned on.
[/quote]UE is a good example, it proves how hard it is for people to work together when we have the server the way it is.

Before we even had ANY plugins, I had my house burned down before. And just like my quote says, I had people helping me rebuild that weren’t living with me, and I had people that helped me figure out who it was.[/quote]Of course if you had moved farther away and didn’t tell anyone where you lived it wouldn’t have even happen. Of course not everyone want’s to live in solitude and that’s fine.

I don't see the problem with spreading out. Staying together and living father apart both have their issues but in the long run I think everyone going their own separate way in smaller groups is for the better. Sure living closer together means other people can watch over others structures but it also means everything is closer together which makes it far more easier for the griefer. The problem with living farther apart is there's no one to watch over your structure besides you and your few closest friends to move with you. The upside is your structure is harder to find.

Even with everyone living together its not going to change anything.
